image.altText: A woman looking at a photo album.

items.synopsis: She thought it was a scam phone call, but it was a mother's worst nightmare, her daughter was an alleged victim of a paedophile child care worker.

title.children: How a piece of fabric helped police track down the man accused of 1,623 child abuse offences

image.altText: Lisa Evans and her daugther, both blonde and tanned, smiling in a photo.

items.synopsis: Breast cancer left Lisa Evans about $20,000 out of pocket, but the cost of monitoring her health continues. She is among patients and medical professionals who have contacted the ABC about concerns there is a gender bias in women's healthcare costs.

title.children: Lisa's cancer diagnosis left her thousands of dollars out of pocket. For her brother, it was a different story

image.altText: Xi Jinping raises his glass and proposes a toast while standing behind a lecturn in front of Chinese flags.

items.synopsis: For much of the past 15 years, China has been developing a weapon that now has become increasingly unstable and that threatens to detonate from within, writes business editor Ian Verrender.

title.children: China's miracle economy is running out of steam. Is it all about to come crashing down?

image.altText: A woman sits at a bench, with a shopping trolley.

items.synopsis: New data shows exactly how much the average cost of some of the most common grocery items have gone up and down in the last year. And the price tags on basic items, like canned tuna and beans, are among those increasing.

title.children: How much are the items in your grocery basket going up or down?

image.altText: Mugshot of a woman with blonde hair

items.synopsis: A judge sentences British nurse Lucy Letby to life in prison for murdering seven babies and attempting to kill six others in a neonatal ward in north-west England.

title.children: 'You have no remorse': British judge sentences baby-killing nurse to life in prison with no chance of parole

image.altText: A close up of James Hayward speaking to reporters.

items.synopsis: A sitting WA parliamentarian is on trial accused of sexually abusing a young girl, with prosecutors telling the court the MP admitted what he had "done" in a suicide email to his wife.

title.children: WA MP facing child sexual abuse charges sent wife 'suicide email' court hears

image.altText: A man walking across a dry dessert

items.synopsis: The Indian Ocean's version of El Niño— a positive Indian Ocean Dipole — typically brings a reduction in rainfall and an increase in temperatures through winter and spring.

title.children: Major weather event that influenced Black Summer bushfires rapidly forming near Australia

image.altText: Men's legs with rainbow socks and football boots

items.synopsis: Not a single elite male AFL player has ever come out publicly as gay or bisexual. This is what happened when Four Corners tried to ask about the silence.

title.children: We tried to tackle the AFL's last great taboo. The code got defensive

image.altText: Woman on a swing with a billowing red dress

items.synopsis: Since the pandemic began, Australians are having more spiritual conversations and thinking about mortality more often. So why do many of us consider ourselves not religious?

title.children: The pandemic made Alana turn to a 'higher power', but made others question their beliefs

image.altText: A photo of the blurred back of a man's head and shoulders. The picture looks at someone sitting at a bench in the d

items.synopsis: There are fears the university sector's highly casualised workforce is preventing people from reporting experiences of sexual violence at work.

title.children: University staff urged to come forward with experiences of sexual harassment and assault

image.altText: A close up of a man smiling as he sits in a chair.

items.synopsis: The return of a billionaire fugitive will set the stage for one of the most dramatic days in Thai political history. Here's what you need to know about former prime minister Thaksin Shinawatra.

title.children: The billionaire patriarch of Thailand's fabled political dynasty is heading home to be arrested. Here's why

image.altText: A US dollar note is pictured alongside an Australian 10 dollar and 20 dollar bill.

items.synopsis: For foreign tourists? Great. For travellers? Terrible. For the economy? A mix. The fall in the Australian dollar has created winners and losers across the economy.

title.children: The Aussie dollar could slump below 60 US cents, bringing with it pain and gain

image.altText: Bawley Point

items.synopsis: Two communities that went without power during Black Summer are getting a microgrid to keep the lights on during network outages. As another dangerous fire season looms, is this technology the way forward?

title.children: Bushfire-scarred Kioloa is bracing for another dangerous summer. But a new technology offers hope

image.altText: Two people in orange suits sit in chairs in a white hospital room

items.synopsis: An independent auditor is brought in over concerns specialist equipment may have been removed from the Royal Hobart Hospital's hyperbaric unit, but determines there's no way to know if — or what — items were taken.

title.children: Fears medical equipment taken from $11m hyperbaric unit, documents show

image.altText: A smiling, older woman stands next a blossoming wisteria tree.

items.synopsis: Following her death in Sydney, family, friends and colleagues look back on the groundbreaking career and rich life of Janet McCredie, whose pioneering research may be unfamiliar to many Australians.

title.children: Groundbreaking thalidomide researcher Janet McCredie mourned after death at 88

image.altText: Peter Dutton wearing a blue suit and light pink tie standing in front of a brick building that is out of focus

items.synopsis: The opposition leader says many of the traumatic scenes he witnessed during his time in the Queensland police force have stayed with him, as they do for many current and former officers.

title.children: Dutton says he likely experienced PTSD from time as police officer

image.altText: An aerial view of an outback city shows a green sports oval and red dirt with the mining stack on the horizon

items.synopsis: A major childcare centre in Mount Isa is set to close, forcing some parents to scale back their working hours to care for children at home as long waitlists at other centres extend.

title.children: Parents can't get to work as childcare crisis worsens in outback Queensland

image.altText: A picture taken from the camera of the lunar landing spacecraft shows Zeeman crater located on the far side of the moon.

items.synopsis: Russia's Luna-25 space craft spun out of control and crashed into the moon as it tried to outpace the Indian mission.

title.children: Russia declares new space race for moon's resources after crashing lander into it

image.altText: A photo of a young girl

items.synopsis: The mother of a three-year-old girl who died in 2019 tells a coronial inquiry she sought medical attention six times for her daughter before her death.

title.children: In the days before Dio Kemp's death, her mother took her to hospital four times and to her GP twice

image.altText: A close-up of the Qantas logo on the tail of one of its planes. The sky behind it is clear.

items.synopsis: A class action lawsuit has been filed against Qantas, claiming it misled customers and failed to issue refunds for cancelled 2020 flights.

title.children: Qantas hit with lawsuit for treating customers 'as providers of $1 billion in interest-free loans'

image.altText: A family of four with cows behind them.

items.synopsis: With neighbouring farms folding on Queensland's Scenic Rim, Kay and Dave Tommerup had to choose between closing or saving their fifth-generation dairy by radically changing how they did business.

title.children: Since cutting ties with its processor this dairy farm now makes four times as much

image.altText: Christos Panagakos in 2020, shirtless with black background

items.synopsis: Christos Panagakos, who was previously charged with the manslaughter of his ex-girlfriend Ivona Jovanovic until the charges were dropped, has been sentenced on a separate case for an assault that happened two years later.

title.children: Gold Coast man previously accused of shooting ex-girlfriend sentenced on unrelated charges

image.altText: Three men in suits outside Queensland's parliament house.

items.synopsis: Young offenders will be forcibly relocated to outback detention camps for "intensive rehabilitation" under a proposal by Katter's Australia Party.

title.children: Young offenders to be 'banished' to outback detention camps under new proposal

image.altText: Brett Orme smiles with sunglasses on top of his head

items.synopsis: A police investigation is underway after the vehicle of a missing man was found abandoned at a wetlands reserve north of Brisbane.

title.children: Possible 'foul play' involved in Brisbane tradie's disappearance, family 'traumatised'

image.altText: Two rangers holding large bundles of sticks in front of a large vertical pile of sticks

items.synopsis: Rangers say picking up a walking stick during a bush walk may seem harmless but it's causing significant damage to the environment.

title.children: Going on a hike? Here’s why you shouldn't pick up sticks to use as walking aids

image.altText: Tayla Cox wears pink and holds her baby girl Murphy

items.synopsis: The bodies of Tayla Black and her daughter, Murphy Margaret were found by police in their Rockhampton home two weeks ago. Ms Black’s husband, Matthew Cox was charged with their murders.

title.children: 'A tragedy for everyone': Man accused of murdering his wife and 11-week-old baby faces court

image.altText: Jack Ziebell yells and points his finger towards the crowd in celebration of a goal.

items.synopsis: Two Narre Warren men were arrested on Monday in connection with an alleged assault of the former North Melbourne player.

title.children: Two men arrested over alleged weekend assault of AFL star Jack Ziebell

image.altText: A photo of a car and a trailer attached to it which has completely collapsed

items.synopsis: A Victorian man recalls the terrifying moment his camper trailer was stolen while he and his partner were sleeping inside on the Great Ocean Road at the weekend.

title.children: Couple have four-wheel drive and camper trailer stolen while sleeping inside

image.altText: Olga Carmona smiles with her World Cup winner's medal around her neck

items.synopsis: Just hours after a player-of-the-match performance in the Women's World Cup final, Spain captain Olga Carmona found out her father had died.

title.children: It should have been the happiest day of her life, but joy turns to sorrow for Spain's World Cup hero

image.altText: Photo illustration of tree-lined Waterloo South street ahead of a state government development, housing tower in the background

items.synopsis: The redevelopment plans in Sydney's Waterloo Estate will now see nearly 500 extra social and affordable homes to address a "huge backlog".

title.children: Controversial redevelopment to unlock hundreds of social and affordable homes near Sydney CBD

image.altText: A man wearing a blue shirt and sunglasses gives the peace sign from the back of a boat with an Indonesian flag on it

items.synopsis: Rescuers end their search for a missing Indonesian crewman one week after a boat with seven on board, including four Australians, hit bad weather off Sumatra.

title.children: Search called off for missing Indonesian crewman from same boat as rescued Australians
